UdÄna-verse, accomplishment aggregate, part 6, section 2 If one accomplishes wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm, does one also accomplish obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm?
One may accomplish wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm without accomplishing obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm. The four alternatives are explained in detail.

One who accomplishes wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm but not obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm is an arhat.ğŸ”½One who accomplishes obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm but not wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm is a learner or an ordinary person who has not yet attained wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm.

One who accomplishes wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm and also obscured-neutral minds belonging to the formless realm is a learner or an ordinary person who has already attained wholesome minds belonging to the formless realm.
Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the formless realm and also do not possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm are not included in this category.
If one possesses wholesome minds associated with the formless realm, does one also possess unobscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm?
If one possesses unobscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm, one definitely possesses wholesome minds associated with the formless realm.

One may possess wholesome minds associated with the formless realm but not unobscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm. This refers to those born in the desire realm and form realm who have already attained wholesome minds associated with the formless realm, and those born in the formless realm for whom the mind as the result of retribution is not presently active.
If one possesses wholesome minds associated with the formless realm, does one also possess learner's minds?
One may possess wholesome minds associated with the formless realm but not learner's minds. The four sentences are explained in detail.

Those who possess wholesome minds associated with the formless realm but not learner's minds refer to arhats and ordinary beings who have already attained wholesome minds associated with the formless realm.

As for those who have attained the mind of learning but not the wholesome mind of the formless realm, it refers to those in the learning stage who have not yet attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm.

As for those who have attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm and also the mind of learning, it refers to those in the learning stage who have already attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm.

As for those who have not attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm and also not the mind of learning, it refers to ordinary beings who have not yet attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm.
If one has attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm, have they also attained the mind of no-more-learning?
If one has attained the mind of no-more-learning, they definitely have attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm.

Or, one may have attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm but not the mind of no-more-learning, namely those in the learning stage and ordinary beings who have already attained the wholesome mind of the formless realm.
If one has the obscured-neutral mind of the formless realm, do they also have the unobscured-neutral mind of the formless realm?
One may possess a formless-realm bound obscured-neutral mind but not a formless-realm bound unobscured-neutral mind. The four sentences are explained in detail.

One who possesses a formless-realm bound obscured-neutral mind but not a formless-realm bound unobscured-neutral mind refers to those born in the desire realm and form realm who are learners and ordinary beings, and those born in the formless realm who are learners and ordinary beings, when the mind of karmic retribution is not presently manifest.

One who possesses a formless-realm bound unobscured-neutral mind but not a formless-realm bound obscured-neutral mind refers to those born in the formless realm who are arhats, when the mind of karmic retribution is presently manifest.

One who possesses a formless-realm bound obscured-neutral mind and also a formless-realm bound unobscured-neutral mind refers to those born in the formless realm who are learners and ordinary beings, when the mind of karmic retribution is presently manifest.

Those who do not possess the obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm and also do not possess the unobscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm are those born in the desire realm and form realm who are arhats, and those born in the formless realm who are arhats, when the mind of karmic retribution is not presently active.
If one possesses the obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm, does one also possess the learner's mind?
If one possesses the learner's mind, one definitely possesses the obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm.

Or, one may possess the obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm but not the learner's mind. This refers to ordinary beings who, if they possess the obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm, definitely do not possess the post-learner's mind.
If one possesses the post-learner's mind, one definitely does not possess the obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm.
If one possesses the unobscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm, does one also possess the learner's mind?
One may possess a formless realm-restrained indeterminate mind but not a learner mind. The four sentences are explained in detail.

One who possesses a formless realm-restrained indeterminate mind but not a learner mind refers to arhats and ordinary beings born in the formless realm whose mind of karmic retribution is presently manifest.

One who possesses a learner mind but not a formless realm-restrained indeterminate mind refers to learners born in the desire realm or form realm, and learners born in the formless realm whose mind of karmic retribution is not presently manifest.
One who possesses a formless realm-restrained indeterminate mind and also a learner mind refers to learners born in the formless realm whose mind of karmic retribution is presently manifest.

One who does not possess a formless realm-restrained indeterminate mind and also not a learner mind refers to arhats and ordinary beings born in the desire realm or form realm, and arhats and ordinary beings born in the formless realm whose mind of karmic retribution is not presently manifest.
If one possesses a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind, does one also possess a post-learner mind?

Either one possesses a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind but not a post-learner mind, or one possesses a post-learner mind but not a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind, or one possesses both a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind and a post-learner mind, or one possesses neither a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind nor a post-learner mind.

Possessing a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind but not a post-learner mind refers to those born in the formless realm whose karmic maturation fruit mind is presently manifest, and who are learners or ordinary beings.

Possessing a post-learner mind but not a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind refers to those in the desire realm and form realm who are arhats, and those in the formless realm who are arhats, but whose karmic maturation fruit mind is not presently manifest.

As for those who obtain formless-realm-connected, neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee minds, and also trainee minds, it refers to arhats born in the formless realm for whom the karmic ripening mind is presently manifest.

As for those who do not obtain formless-realm-connected, neither-trainee-nor-non-trainee minds, nor trainee minds, it refers to trainees and ordinary beings born in the desire realm and form realm, and trainees and ordinary beings born in the formless realm for whom the karmic ripening mind is not presently manifest.
If one obtains a trainee mind, one definitely does not obtain a non-trainee mind.
If one obtains a non-trainee mind, one definitely does not obtain a trainee mind.

There are twelve minds, namely: wholesome minds connected to the desire realm, unwholesome minds, obscured-neutral minds, and non-obscured-neutral minds, wholesome minds connected to the form realm, obscured-neutral minds, and non-obscured-neutral minds, wholesome minds connected to the formless realm, obscured-neutral minds, and non-obscured-neutral minds, and trainee minds and non-trainee minds.
If one does not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm, does one also not possess an unwholesome mind?
If one does not possess an unwholesome mind,
does one also not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm?ğŸ”½If one does not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm, does one also not possess a non-learner's mind?
If one does not possess a non-learner's mind, does one also not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm?
Up to if one does not possess a learner's mind, does one also not possess a non-learner's mind?
If one does not possess a non-learner's mind, does one also not possess a learner's mind?
If one does not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm, does one also not possess an unwholesome mind?

There are four possibilities: One may not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm but not an unwholesome mind, or one may not possess an unwholesome mind but not a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm, or one may not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm and also an unwholesome mind, or one may not not possess a wholesome mind bound to the desire realm and also not an unwholesome mind.
Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm but do possess unwholesome minds are those who have severed wholesome roots.

Those who do not possess unwholesome minds but do possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm are those who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm while still dwelling in the desire realm.
Those who do not possess either wholesome minds associated with the desire realm or unwholesome minds are those who are dwelling in the form realm or formless realm.

Those who do not possess either wholesome minds associated with the desire realm or unwholesome minds are those who have not severed wholesome roots and have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm.
If one does not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm, do they also not possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the desire realm?
There are four possibilities for not possessing wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and not possessing obscured-neutral minds associated with the desire realm.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm but do possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the desire realm are those who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm while still dwelling in the desire realm.ğŸ”½Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm but do possess unwholesome minds are those who have severed wholesome roots.

Those who do not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought but do possess a desire realm-connected wholesome thought are ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have already abandoned desire realm attachment, and noble ones who have not yet abandoned desire realm attachment but have already produced the cognition of the dharma of suffering at the stage of the culmination of the practice.
Those who do not possess a desire realm-connected wholesome thought and also do not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought are individuals born in the form realm or formless realm.

Those who do not not possess a desire realm-connected wholesome thought and also do not not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought are ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have not severed wholesome roots and have not yet abandoned desire realm attachment, and noble ones who have not yet abandoned desire realm attachment but have not yet produced the cognition of the dharma of suffering at the stage of the culmination of the practice.
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected wholesome thought, do they also not possess a desire realm-connected unobscured neutral thought?
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected unobscured neutral thought, they definitely do not possess a desire realm-connected wholesome thought.

One may not be accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but still be accompanied by a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm. This refers to those who have severed wholesome roots and to those in the form realm who have not yet attained the wholesome mind associated with the desire realm.
If one is not accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, is one also not accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the form realm?

One may not be accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but still be accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the form realm. There are four possibilities.ğŸ”½One is not accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but still is accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the form realm. This refers to those in the form realm who have not yet attained the wholesome mind associated with the desire realm.ğŸ”½One is not accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the form realm but still is accompanied by a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm. This refers to those in the desire realm who have not severed wholesome roots but have not yet attained the wholesome mind associated with the form realm.

One is not accompanied by either a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm or a wholesome mind associated with the form realm. This refers to those who have severed wholesome roots and to those in the formless realm.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and also do not possess wholesome minds associated with the form realm refer to those beings dwelling in the desire realm who have already attained wholesome minds associated with the form realm.
If one does not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm, does one also not possess wholesome minds associated with the form realm?

There are four possibilities for not possessing wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and not possessing wholesome minds associated with the form realm.ğŸ”½Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm but do possess wholesome minds associated with the form realm refer to those who have already severed wholesome roots and those beings dwelling in the form realm who have not yet abandoned craving for the form realm.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the form realm but do possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm refer to those beings dwelling in the desire realm who have already abandoned craving for the form realm.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and also obscured-neutral minds associated with the form realm are those born in the form realm who have already abandoned craving for the form realm, and those born in the formless realm.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and also do not possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the form realm are those born in the desire realm who have not severed wholesome roots and have not yet abandoned craving for the form realm.
If one does not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm, do they also not possess unobscured-neutral minds associated with the form realm?
There are four possibilities for not possessing wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and also not possessing unobscured-neutral minds associated with the form realm.
Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm but do possess unobscured-neutral minds associated with the form realm are those born in the form realm.

Those who do not possess a formless realm unobscured neutral mind but do possess a desire realm wholesome mind are those born in the desire realm who have not severed wholesome roots and have not yet abandoned desire for the desire realm.ğŸ”½Those who do not possess a desire realm wholesome mind and also do not possess a form realm unobscured neutral mind are those who have severed wholesome roots and those born in the formless realm.

Those who do not possess a desire realm wholesome mind and also do not possess a form realm unobscured neutral mind are those born in the desire realm who have already abandoned desire for the desire realm.
If one does not possess a desire realm wholesome mind, do they also not possess a formless realm wholesome mind?
Or there are those who do not possess a desire realm wholesome mind but do possess a formless realm wholesome mind, and so on, with four possibilities.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm but do possess wholesome minds associated with the formless realm are beings born in the form realm who have already attained wholesome minds associated with the formless realm, and beings born in the formless realm.ğŸ”½Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the formless realm but do possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm are beings born in the desire realm who have not severed wholesome roots and have not yet attained wholesome minds associated with the formless realm.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm or wholesome minds associated with the formless realm are beings who have severed wholesome roots, and beings born in the form realm who have not yet attained wholesome minds associated with the formless realm.

Those who do not not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm or wholesome minds associated with the formless realm are beings born in the desire realm who have already attained wholesome minds associated with the formless realm.

If one does not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm, do they also not possess wholesome minds associated with the formless realm and obscured-neutral minds associated with the formless realm?

One may not acquire a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but not an obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm. The four alternatives are explained in detail.ğŸ”½One who does not acquire a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but does acquire an obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm refers to those who have severed wholesome roots and those born in the form and formless realms, as well as learners and ordinary beings.

One who does not acquire an obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm but does acquire a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm refers to those born in the desire realm who are arhats.

One who does not acquire a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm or an obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm refers to those born in the form and formless realms who are arhats.

One who does not not acquire a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm or an obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm refers to those born in the desire realm who are learners, and ordinary beings who have not severed wholesome roots.
If one does not acquire a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, does one also not acquire an unobscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm?

Or, one may not be in possession of a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, but not a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm. The four alternatives are explained in detail.

One who is not in possession of a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, but is in possession of a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm, refers to one born and dwelling in the formless realm, with the mind of karmic retribution presently manifest.

One who is not in possession of a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm, but is in possession of a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, refers to one born in the desire realm who has not severed wholesome roots.

One who is not in possession of a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, nor a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm, refers to one who has severed wholesome roots, and one born and dwelling in the form realm or formless realm, where the mind of karmic retribution is not presently manifest.
One who is not not in possession of a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, nor a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm, there is no such case.
If one is not in possession of a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, is one also not in possession of a learner's mind?
One may not possess a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but possess a learner's mind, and so on, with four possibilities.
One who does not possess a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but possesses a learner's mind refers to those in the form and formless realms who are learners.

One who does not possess a learner's mind but a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm refers to those born in the desire realm who are arhats, and ordinary beings who have not severed wholesome roots.

One who does not possess a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm or a learner's mind refers to those who have severed wholesome roots, and arhats and ordinary beings born in the form and formless realms.
One who does not not possess a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm or a learner's mind refers to those born in the desire realm who are learners.
If one does not possess a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm, does one also not possess a non-learner's mind?
One may not possess a wholesome mind associated with the desire realm but possess a non-learner's mind, and so on, with four possibilities.
Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm but do possess the mind of one beyond training are those born in the form and formless realms who are arhats.

Those who do not possess the mind of one beyond training but do possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm are those born in the desire realm who are learners or ordinary beings who have not severed the wholesome roots.

Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and also do not possess the mind of one beyond training are those who have severed the wholesome roots, and those born in the form and formless realms who are learners or ordinary beings.
Those who do not possess wholesome minds associated with the desire realm and also do not possess the mind of one beyond training are arhats born in the desire realm.
If one does not possess unwholesome minds, do they also not possess minds associated with the desire realm that are covered by afflictions and indeterminate?
If one does not possess unwholesome minds, they definitely do not possess minds associated with the desire realm that are covered by afflictions and indeterminate.

Or, one may not possess minds associated with the desire realm that are covered by afflictions and indeterminate but not unwholesome minds, namely, noble ones who have not yet severed attachment to the desire realm, and for whom the knowledge of the dharma of suffering at the stage of penetrating insight has already arisen.
If one does not possess a non-virtuous mind, does one also not possess a desire realm-connected unobscured-neutral mind?
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected unobscured-neutral mind, one definitely does not possess a non-virtuous mind.

One may not possess a non-virtuous mind but not not possess a desire realm-connected unobscured-neutral mind, namely a person born in the desire realm who has already abandoned desire realm craving, and a person born in the form realm.
If one does not possess a non-virtuous mind, does one also not possess a form realm-connected wholesome mind?

One may not possess a non-virtuous mind but not a form realm-connected wholesome mind, and so on, with four alternatives.ğŸ”½One does not possess a non-virtuous mind but not a form realm-connected wholesome mind, namely a person born in the desire realm who has already abandoned desire realm craving, and a person born in the form realm.
One does not possess a form realm-connected wholesome mind but not a non-virtuous mind, namely a person born in the desire realm who has not yet obtained a form realm wholesome mind.
Those who do not possess unwholesome minds also do not possess wholesome minds bound to the form realm. This refers to individuals born and abiding in the formless realm.

Those who do not possess unwholesome minds and also do not possess wholesome minds bound to the form realm. This refers to individuals born in the desire realm who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm but have already attained wholesome minds bound to the form realm.
If one does not possess unwholesome minds, do they also not possess wholesome minds bound to the form realm and obscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm?
If one does not possess wholesome minds bound to the form realm, they definitely do not possess unwholesome minds.

Or there are those who do not possess unwholesome minds but do not possess wholesome minds bound to the form realm and obscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm. This refers to individuals born in the desire realm who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm but have not yet abandoned craving for the form realm, and individuals born in the form realm who have not yet abandoned that craving.
If one does not possess unwholesome minds, do they also not possess unobscured-neutral minds bound to the form realm?

One who does not possess a formless realm obscured neutral mind but does possess a non-virtuous mind refers to those born in the desire realm who have not yet abandoned desire realm craving.
One who does not possess a non-virtuous mind and also does not possess a formless realm obscured neutral mind refers to those born in the formless realm.
One who does not not possess a non-virtuous mind and also does not not possess a formless realm obscured neutral mind is impossible.
If one does not possess a non-virtuous mind, does one also not possess a formless realm wholesome mind?
One may not possess a non-virtuous mind but possess a formless realm wholesome mind, and so on, with four possibilities.

Those who do not possess a non-good mind but do possess a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm are beings born in the desire realm and form realm who have already attained a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm, as well as beings born in the formless realm.ğŸ”½Those who do not possess a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm but do possess a non-good mind are beings born in the desire realm who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm.

Those who do not possess a non-good mind and also do not possess a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm are beings born in the desire realm who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm but have not yet attained a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm, as well as beings born in the form realm who have not yet attained a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm.
Those who do not not possess a non-good mind and also do not not possess a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm do not exist.
If one does not possess a non-good mind, does one also not possess a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm that is covered by afflictions?
If one does not possess a wholesome mind bound to the formless realm that is covered by afflictions, one definitely does not possess a non-good mind.

One may not possess a non-good mind but not a defiled mind associated with the realm of form. This refers to those still learning and ordinary beings who have already abandoned craving of the desire realm.
If one does not possess a non-good mind, does one also not possess a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm?

One may not possess a non-good mind but not a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm. This refers to those born in the desire realm who have not yet abandoned craving of the desire realm.

One does not possess a non-good mind nor a non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm. This refers to those born in the desire realm who have already abandoned craving of the desire realm, and those born in the form realm or formless realm for whom the mind as retribution is not presently manifest.
Those who do not possess a non-good mind and also do not possess a formless realm-connected unobscured-neutral mind do not have this phrase.
If one does not possess a non-good mind, does one also not possess a mind of training?

There are four possibilities for not possessing a non-good mind and not possessing a mind of training.ğŸ”½Not possessing a non-good mind but not a mind of training refers to those in training who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm.
Not possessing a mind of training but not a non-good mind refers to ordinary beings dwelling in the desire realm who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm.
Not possessing a non-good mind and also a mind of training refers to arhats and ordinary beings who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm.
Not not possessing a non-good mind and also not a mind of training refers to those in training who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm.
If one does not possess a non-good mind, does one also not possess a mind of no-more-training?
There are four possibilities for not possessing a non-good mind and not possessing a mind of no-more-training.

Those who do not possess a non-good mind but do possess a non-learner mind are arhats.ğŸ”½Those who do not possess a learner mind but do possess a non-good mind are learners and ordinary beings who have not yet abandoned craving for the desire realm.
Those who do not possess a non-good mind and also do not possess a learner mind are learners and ordinary beings who have already abandoned craving for the desire realm.

Those who do not possess a non-good mind and also do not possess a learner mind do not exist.ğŸ”½If one does not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind, does one also not possess a desire realm-connected unobscured neutral mind?
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected unobscured neutral mind, one definitely does not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind.

One may not be accompanied by the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm but be accompanied by the non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm. This refers to ordinary beings living in the desire realm who have already abandoned the desire of the desire realm, and to noble ones who have not yet abandoned the desire of the desire realm but have already produced the knowledge of the law in regard to the suffering of the path of insight. It also refers to beings living in the form realm.
If one is not accompanied by the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm, is one also not accompanied by the wholesome mind associated with the form realm?

One may not be accompanied by the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm but be accompanied by the wholesome mind associated with the form realm. There are four alternative explanations.

One may not be accompanied by the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm but be accompanied by the wholesome mind associated with the form realm. This refers to ordinary beings living in the desire realm who have already abandoned the desire of the desire realm, and to noble ones who have not yet abandoned the desire of the desire realm but have already produced the knowledge of the law in regard to the suffering of the path of insight. It also refers to beings living in the form realm.

Those who do not possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the desire realm and also wholesome minds associated with the form realm are beings dwelling in the formless realm.

Those who do not not possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the desire realm and also do not possess wholesome minds associated with the form realm are ordinary beings dwelling in the desire realm who have not yet eliminated the desire of the desire realm and have attained wholesome minds associated with the form realm, and also noble ones who have not yet given rise to the knowledge of the dharma with regard to the suffering of the stage of penetrating insight.
If one does not possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the desire realm, does one also not possess obscured-neutral minds associated with the form realm?

One may not be devoid of the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm, but not be devoid of the obscured-neutral mind associated with the form realm. This refers to ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have already abandoned the desire of the desire realm but not the desire of the form realm, and to noble ones at the stage of the knowledge of the dharma of suffering in the path of seeing who have already produced the knowledge of suffering in the path of seeing, and to beings born in the form realm who have not yet abandoned the desire of that realm.
If one is not devoid of the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm, is one also not devoid of the non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the form realm?

One may not be devoid of the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm, but not be devoid of the non-obscured-neutral mind associated with the form realm. Those who do not possess a formless realm unobscured neutral mind but do possess a desire realm obscured neutral mind are ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have not yet abandoned desire for the desire realm, and noble ones who have not yet produced the knowledge of dharmas regarding suffering at the stage of the aspects of the truths.
Those who do not possess a desire realm obscured neutral mind and also do not possess a form realm unobscured neutral mind are individuals born in the formless realm.
There is no such phrase as those who do not possess a desire realm obscured neutral mind and also do not possess a form realm unobscured neutral mind.
If one does not possess a desire realm obscured neutral mind, do they also not possess a formless realm wholesome mind?
There are four possibilities for not possessing a desire realm obscured neutral mind and not possessing a formless realm wholesome mind, and so on.

Those who do not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured, indeterminate mind but do possess a formless realm-connected wholesome mind are those born in the desire realm or form realm who have already attained a formless realm wholesome mind, and those born in the formless realm.ğŸ”½Those who do not possess a formless realm-connected wholesome mind but do possess a desire realm-connected obscured indeterminate mind are ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have not yet eliminated desire realm attachment, and noble ones who have not yet generated the cognition of the dharma of suffering at the stage of the culmination of the practice.

Those who do not possess a desire realm-connected obscured indeterminate mind and also do not possess a formless realm-connected wholesome mind are ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have already eliminated desire realm attachment but have not yet attained a formless realm wholesome mind, and noble ones who have already generated the cognition of the dharma of suffering at the stage of the culmination of the practice but have not yet eliminated desire realm attachment. Those born in the form realm who have not yet attained a formless realm wholesome mind.
Those who do not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind also do not possess a wholesome mind of the formless realm. There is no such phrase.
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind, does one also not possess an obscured neutral mind of the formless realm?
If one does not possess an obscured neutral mind of the formless realm, one definitely does not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind.

Or one may not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind but not an obscured neutral mind of the formless realm, namely ordinary beings who have already separated from desire of the desire realm, and noble ones who have not yet separated from desire of the desire realm, and the knowledge of dharmas at the end of the uninterrupted stage of the truth of suffering has already arisen.
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind, does one also not possess an unobscured neutral mind of the formless realm?
Or one may not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind but not an unobscured neutral mind of the formless realm. The four phrases are explained in detail.

Those who do not possess the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm but do possess the unobscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm are those born in the formless realm for whom the mind as retribution is presently manifest.

Those who do not possess the unobscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm but do possess the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm are ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have not yet eliminated the desire of the desire realm, and noble ones who have not yet generated the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering at the stage of the path of insight.

Those who do not possess the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm and also do not possess the unobscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm are ordinary beings born in the desire realm who have already eliminated the desire of the desire realm, and noble ones born in the desire realm who have generated the cognition of the doctrine with regard to suffering at the stage of the path of insight, and those born in the form realm or the formless realm for whom the mind as retribution is not presently manifest.
Those who do not not possess the obscured-neutral mind associated with the desire realm and also do not not possess the unobscured-neutral mind associated with the formless realm are nonexistent.
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind, does one also not possess a mind of one still learning?

There are four possibilities for not possessing a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind and not possessing a mind of one still learning.ğŸ”½Not possessing a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind but not a mind of one still learning refers to those still learning for whom the knowledge of the dharmas regarding the suffering at the end of the vision has already arisen.

Not possessing a mind of one still learning but not a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind refers to ordinary beings dwelling in the desire realm who have not yet eliminated desire for the desire realm.
Not possessing a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind and also a mind of one still learning refers to arhats and ordinary beings who have already eliminated desire for the desire realm.

Not not possessing a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind and not not possessing a mind of one still learning refers to noble ones who have not yet eliminated desire for the desire realm and for whom the knowledge of the dharmas regarding the suffering at the end of the vision has not yet arisen.
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected obscured neutral mind, does one also not possess a mind of one beyond further learning?

One may not be in a state of not having attained a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought but be in a state of not having attained a thought of one beyond training, and so on, with four alternatives.

One who is not in a state of not having attained a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought but is in a state of not having attained a thought of one beyond training is an arhat.ğŸ”½One who is not in a state of not having attained a thought of one beyond training but is in a state of not having attained a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought is a common person dwelling in the desire realm who has not yet eliminated desire for the desire realm, and a noble one in the desire realm who has not yet generated the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering at the stage of the culmination of the practice.

One who is not in a state of not having attained a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought and is also not in a state of not having attained a thought of one beyond training is a common person dwelling in the desire realm who has already eliminated desire for the desire realm, and a noble one in the desire realm who has already generated the knowledge of the dharma with regard to suffering at the stage of the culmination of the practice, and a learner or a common person dwelling in the form or formless realms.
One who is not in a state of not having attained a desire realm-connected obscured neutral thought and is also not in a state of not having attained a thought of one beyond training does not exist.
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind, does one also not possess a form realm-connected wholesome mind?
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind, one definitely does not possess a form realm-connected wholesome mind.

One may not possess a form realm-connected wholesome mind but not a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind. This refers to a person who is born in the desire realm and has not yet attained a form realm wholesome mind.

If one does not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind, one definitely does not possess a form realm-connected, obscured-neutral mind.

One may not possess a form realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind but not a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind. This refers to a person dwelling in the desire realm who has not yet eliminated desire for the desire realm.

One may not be in a state of non-possession of the unobscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the desire realm, but not the obscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the formless realm. The four alternatives are explained in detail.

One who is not in a state of non-possession of the unobscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the desire realm, but is in a state of non-possession of the obscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the formless realm, refers to those born in the formless realm, learners and ordinary beings.

One who is not in a state of non-possession of the obscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the formless realm, but is in a state of non-possession of the unobscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the desire realm, refers to those born in the desire realm and form realm, all arhats.

One who is not in a state of non-possession of the unobscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the desire realm, and also not in a state of non-possession of the obscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the formless realm, refers to those born in the formless realm, all arhats.

One who is not in a state of non-possession of the unobscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the desire realm, and also not in a state of non-possession of the obscured-indeterminate mind belonging to the formless realm, refers to those born in the desire realm and form realm, learners and ordinary beings.
If one does not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind, does one also not possess a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind?

Or one does not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind but does not not possess a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind, and so on, explaining the four sentences in detail.

One does not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind but does not not possess a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind refers to those born and abiding in the formless realms, with the karmic ripening mind presently manifest.

One does not possess a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind but does not not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind refers to those born and abiding in the desire realm and form realm.

One does not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind and also does not possess a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind refers to those born and abiding in the formless realms, with the karmic ripening mind not presently manifest.
Those who do not possess a desire realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind and also do not possess a formless realm-connected, unobscured-neutral mind do not have this phrase.
